data.text: @CalMatters This is a moronic tweet. There about 500,000 black children in California. So, 6 black children died? Is that statistically significant? Might as well tell us kids born on Wednesdays were the third most likely to die to covid after Sundays and Thursdays.
@dlwes23 @dalscorpio73 @CalMatters The lack of proper access to care for children is not a negative thing about that group, it's a negative thing about the group who do have access to to proper care.
@dlwes23 @dalscorpio73 @CalMatters I don't actually hear myself here shouting you down.
@lizzz_818 @dalscorpio73 @CalMatters Why it’s like that, people like you shout us done and tell us how it “really” is from your whyte perspective.🙄

@lizzz_818 @dalscorpio73 @CalMatters The fact that you called it a bubble let’s me know we not even having the same conversation. Continue to be obtuse but the bottom line is, people like you love to look at the negatives about a group and pretend to care about being “aware” but when we try and tell you

@dlwes23 @dalscorpio73 @CalMatters I can see why you would think that,  and it may be very true in your bubble.  But it's not true in mine. I know tons of caring people who act on information even if only in a small way.
@lizzz_818 @dalscorpio73 @CalMatters Why bring awareness if NOONE wants to hear the contributing factors?

@dalscorpio73 @dlwes23 @CalMatters I don't think they're trying to preach to the choir here, I think they are raising awareness with people who don't have direct experience with being at the top of the list. If people don't know something, how can they contribute to solutions that take everyone's work to fix?

@lizzz_818 @dlwes23 @CalMatters What I think is we know is our kids are always at risk. Hell when we , our parents, their parents and their parents have always been at risk. Nothing new. History shows it. Another reason why the don’t teach CRT and get rid of books movements exist. To hide ugly done by ypippo.
@dlwes23 @rr_mandy @CalMatters Sure you are.  Depends on age of population, diversity, who is in the front line in nursing/EMS, access to child care, access to services, and so on.
